12 
13 ulong RNG::tm = 1234567;
14 ulong RNG::kn[128], RNG::ke[256];
15 double RNG::wn[128], RNG::fn[128], RNG::we[256], RNG::fe[256];

18 //________________________________________________________________________
19 // RNG::RNOR generates normal variates with rejection.
20 // nfix() generates variates after rejection in RNOR.
21 // Despite rejection, this method is faster than Box-Muller.
22 
23 double RNG::nfix(slong h, ulong i)
24 {
25  const double r = 3.442620; // The starting of the right tail
26 
27  double x, y;
28  for(;;) {
29  x = h * wn[i];
30 
31  // If i == 0, handle the base strip
32  if (i == 0) {
33  do {
34  x = -log(rand_open01()) * 0.2904764; // .2904764 is 1/r
35  y = -log(rand_open01());
36  } while (y + y < x * x);
37  return ((h > 0) ? r + x : -r - x);
38  }
39 
40  // If i > 0, handle the wedges of other strips
41  if (fn[i] + rand_open01() * (fn[i - 1] - fn[i]) < exp(-.5 * x * x))
42  return x;
43 
44  // start all over
45  h = UL32toSL32(rand_int32());
46  i = h & 127;
47  if (ULONG32(std::abs(h)) < kn[i])
48  return (h * wn[i]);
49  }
50 
51 } // RNG::nfix
52 
53 // __________________________________________________________________________
54 // RNG::REXP generates exponential variates with rejection.
55 // efix() generates variates after rejection in REXP.
56 
57 double RNG::efix(ulong j, ulong i)
58 {
59  for (;;) {
60  if (i == 0)
61  return (7.69711 - log(rand_open01()));
62 
63  const double x = j * we[i];
64  if (fe[i] + rand_open01() * (fe[i - 1] - fe[i]) < exp(-x))
65  return x;
66 
67  j = rand_int32();
68  i = (j & 255);
69  if (j < ke[i])
70  return (j * we[i]);
71  }
72 
73 } // RNG::efix
74 
75 // __________________________________________________________________________
76 // This procedure creates the tables used by RNOR and REXP
77 
78 void RNG::zigset()
79 {
80  static bool inited = 0;
81  if (inited)
82  return;
83  inited = 1;
84 
85  // Set up tables for RNOR
86  const double m1 = 2147483648.0; // 2^31
87  const double vn = 9.91256303526217e-3;
88  double tn = 3.442619855899;
89  double q = vn / exp(-.5 * tn * tn);
90  kn[0] = ULONG32((tn / q) * m1); kn[1] = 0;
91  wn[0] = q / m1; wn[127] = tn / m1;
92  fn[0]=1.; fn[127] = exp(-.5 * tn * tn);
93  for (uint i = 126; i > 0; i--) {
94  const double dn = sqrt(-2 * log(vn / tn + exp(-.5 * tn * tn)));
95  kn[i + 1] = ULONG32((dn / tn) * m1);
96  fn[i] = exp(-.5 * dn * dn);
97  wn[i] = dn / m1;
98  tn = dn;
99  }
100 
101  // Set up tables for REXP
102  const double m2 = 4294967296.0; // 2^32
103  const double ve = 3.949659822581572e-3;
104  double te = 7.697117470131487;
105  q = ve / exp(-te);
106  ke[0] = ULONG32((te / q) * m2); ke[1] = 0;
107  we[0] = q / m2; we[255] = te / m2;
108  fe[0] = 1.; fe[255] = exp(-te);
109  for (uint i = 254; i > 0; i--) {
110  const double de = -log(ve / te + exp(-te));
111  ke[i+1] = ULONG32((de / te) * m2);
112  fe[i] = exp(-de);
113  we[i] = de / m2;
114  te = de;
115  }
116 
117 } // RNG::zigset
118 
119 // __________________________________________________________________________
120 // Generate a gamma variate with parameters 'shape' and 'scale'
121 
122 double RNG::gamma(double shape, double scale)
123 {
124 
125  if (shape < 1.)
126  return gamma(shape + 1., scale) * pow(rand_open01(), 1.0 / shape);
127 
128  const double d = shape - 1. / 3.;
129  const double c = 1. / sqrt(9. * d);
130  double x, v;
131  for (;;) {
132  do {
133  x = RNOR();
134  v = 1.0 + c * x;
135  } while (v <= 0.0);
136  v = v * v * v;
137  const double u = rand_open01();
138  const double x2 = x * x;
139  if (u < 1.0 - 0.0331 * x2 * x2)
140  return (d * v / scale);
141  if (log(u) < 0.5 * x2 + d * (1.0 - v + log(v)))
142  return (d * v / scale);
143  }
144 } // RNG::gamma
145 
146 // __________________________________________________________________________
147 // Generate a Poisson variate
148 // Code essentially copied from R source that is essentially
149 // ACM Algorithm 599 KPOISS converted to C.
150 
151 int RNG::poisson(double mu)
152 {
153  const double a0=-0.5, a1= 0.3333333, a2=-0.2500068, a3= 0.2000118,
154  a4=-0.1661269, a5= 0.1421878, a6=-0.1384794, a7= 0.1250060;
155 
156  const double one_7 = 1.0 / 7.0, one_12 = 1.0 / 12.0, one_24 = 1.0 / 24.0;
157 
158  const double fact[10] =
159  { 1., 1., 2., 6., 24., 120., 720., 5040., 40320., 362880. };
160 
161  static int l, m;
162 
163  static double b1, b2, c, c0, c1, c2, c3;
164  static double pp[36], p0, p, q, s, d, omega;
165  static double big_l;/* integer "w/o overflow" */
166  static double muprev = 0., muprev2 = 0.;/*, muold = 0.*/
167 
168  double del, difmuk= 0., E= 0., fk= 0., fx, fy, g, px, py, t, u= 0., v, x;
169  int pois = -1;
170  int k, kflag, big_mu, new_big_mu = 0;
171 
172  if (mu <= 0.)
173  return 0;
174 
175  big_mu = mu >= 10.;
176  if(big_mu)
177  new_big_mu = 0;
178 
179  if (!(big_mu && mu == muprev)) {
180 
181  if (big_mu) {
182  new_big_mu = 1;
183  muprev = mu;
184  s = sqrt(mu);
185  d = 6. * mu * mu;
186  big_l = floor(mu - 1.1484);
187  }
188  else {
189  if (mu != muprev) {
190  muprev = mu;
191  m = (int) ((1.0 < mu) ? mu : 1.0);
192  l = 0; /* pp[] is already ok up to pp[l] */
193  q = p0 = p = exp(-mu);
194  }
195 
196  for (;;) {
197  u = rand_open01();
198  if (u <= p0)
199  return 0;
200 
201  if (l != 0) {
202  for (k = (u <= 0.458) ? 1 : ((l < m) ? l : m); k <= l; k++)
203  if (u <= pp[k])
204  return k;
205  if (l == 35) /* u > pp[35] */
206  continue;
207  }
208  l++;
209  for (k = l; k <= 35; k++) {
210  p *= mu / k;
211  q += p;
212  pp[k] = q;
213  if (u <= q) {
214  l = k;
215  return k;
216  }
217  }
218  l = 35;
219  }
220  }
221 
222  }
223 
224  g = mu + s * RNOR();
225  if (g >= 0.) {
226  pois = int(g);
227  if (pois >= big_l)
228  return pois;
229  fk = pois;
230  difmuk = mu - fk;
231  u = rand_open01();
232  if (d * u >= difmuk * difmuk * difmuk)
233  return pois;
234  }
235 
236  if (new_big_mu || mu != muprev2) {
237  muprev2 = mu;
238  omega = 1.0 / (sqrt(2.0 * PI) * s);
239  b1 = one_24 / mu;
240  b2 = 0.3 * b1 * b1;
241  c3 = one_7 * b1 * b2;
242  c2 = b2 - 15. * c3;
243  c1 = b1 - 6. * b2 + 45. * c3;
244  c0 = 1. - b1 + 3. * b2 - 15. * c3;
245  c = 0.1069 / mu;
246  }
247 
248  if (g >= 0.) {
249  kflag = 0;
250  goto Step_F;
251  }
252 
253 
254  for (;;) {
255  E = REXP();
256  u = 2 * rand_open01() - 1.;
257  t = 1.8 + ((u > 0) ? std::abs(E) : -std::abs(E));
258  if (t > -0.6744) {
259  pois = int(mu + s * t);
260  fk = pois;
261  difmuk = mu - fk;
262  kflag = 1;
263 Step_F:
264  if (pois < 10) {
265  px = -mu;
266  py = pow(mu, pois) / fact[pois];
267  }
268  else {
269  del = one_12 / fk;
270  del = del * (1. - 4.8 * del * del);
271  v = difmuk / fk;
272  if (std::abs(v) <= 0.25)
273  px = fk * v * v * (((((((a7 * v + a6) * v + a5) * v + a4) *
274  v + a3) * v + a2) * v + a1) * v + a0)
275  - del;
276  else
277  px = fk * log(1. + v) - difmuk - del;
278  py = 1.0 / (sqrt(2.0 * PI) * sqrt(fk));
279  }
280  x = (0.5 - difmuk) / s;
281  x *= x;/* x^2 */
282  fx = -0.5 * x;
283  fy = omega * (((c3 * x + c2) * x + c1) * x + c0);
284  if (kflag > 0) {
285  if (c * std::abs(u) <= py * exp(px + E) - fy * exp(fx + E))
286  break;
287  } else
288  if (fy - u * fy <= py * exp(px - fx))
289  break;
290  }
291  }
292  return pois;
293 
294 } // RNG::poisson

296 // __________________________________________________________________________
297 // Generate a binomial variate
298 // Code essentially copied from R source that is essentially
299 // ACM Algorithm 678 BTPEC converted to C.
300 
301 int RNG::binomial(double pp, int n)
302 {
303  static double c, fm, npq, p1, p2, p3, p4, qn, xl, xll, xlr, xm, xr;
304 
305  static double psave = -1.0;
306  static int nsave = -1, m = 0;
307 
308  double f, x;
309 
310  if (n <= 0 || pp <= 0.) return 0;
311  if (pp >= 1.) return n;
312 
313  const double p = (pp < 1. - pp) ? pp : 1. - pp;
314  const double q = 1. - p;
315  const double np = n * p;
316  const double r = p / q;
317  const double g = r * (n + 1);
318 
319  if (pp != psave || n != nsave) {
320  psave = pp;
321  nsave = n;
322  if (np < 30.0) {
323  qn = pow(q, (double) n);
324  goto L_np_small;
325  } else {
326  double ffm = np + p;
327  m = (int) ffm;
328  fm = m;
329  npq = np * q;
330  p1 = (int)(2.195 * sqrt(npq) - 4.6 * q) + 0.5;
331  xm = fm + 0.5;
332  xl = xm - p1;
333  xr = xm + p1;
334  c = 0.134 + 20.5 / (15.3 + fm);
335  double al = (ffm - xl) / (ffm - xl * p);
336  xll = al * (1.0 + 0.5 * al);
337  al = (xr - ffm) / (xr * q);
338  xlr = al * (1.0 + 0.5 * al);
339  p2 = p1 * (1.0 + c + c);
340  p3 = p2 + c / xll;
341  p4 = p3 + c / xlr;
342  }
343  } else if (n == nsave) {
344  if (np < 30.0)
345  goto L_np_small;
346  }
347 
348  int i, ix;
349  for (;;) {
350  double u = rand_open01() * p4;
351  double v = rand_open01();
352  if (u <= p1) {
353  ix = (int) (xm - p1 * v + u);
354  goto finish;
355  }
356  if (u <= p2) {
357  x = xl + (u - p1) / c;
358  v = v * c + 1.0 - std::abs(xm - x) / p1;
359  if (v > 1.0 || v <= 0.)
360  continue;
361  ix = (int) x;
362  } else {
363  if (u > p3) {
364  ix = (int) (xr - log(v) / xlr);
365  if (ix > n)
366  continue;
367  v *= (u - p3) * xlr;
368  } else {/* left tail */
369  ix = (int) (xl + log(v) / xll);
370  if (ix < 0)
371  continue;
372  v *= (u - p2) * xll;
373  }
374  }
375  int k = std::abs(ix - m);
376  if (k <= 20 || k >= npq / 2 - 1) {
377  f = 1.0;
378  if (m < ix) {
379  for (i = m + 1; i <= ix; i++)
380  f *= (g / i - r);
381  } else if (m != ix) {
382  for (i = ix + 1; i <= m; i++)
383  f /= (g / i - r);
384  }
385  if (v <= f)
386  goto finish;
387  } else {
388  double amaxp, ynorm, alv;
389  amaxp = (k / npq) * ((k * (k / 3. + 0.625) + 0.1666666666666) /
390  npq + 0.5);
391  ynorm = -k * k / (2.0 * npq);
392  alv = log(v);
393  if (alv < ynorm - amaxp)
394  goto finish;
395  if (alv <= ynorm + amaxp) {
396  double x1, f1, z, w, z2, x2, f2, w2;
397  x1 = ix + 1;
398  f1 = fm + 1.0;
399  z = n + 1 - fm;
400  w = n - ix + 1.0;
401  z2 = z * z;
402  x2 = x1 * x1;
403  f2 = f1 * f1;
404  w2 = w * w;
405  if (alv <= xm * log(f1 / x1) + (n - m + 0.5) * log(z / w) +
406  (ix - m) * log(w * p / (x1 * q)) + (13860.0 - (462.0 -
407  (132.0 - (99.0 - 140.0 / f2) / f2) / f2) / f2) / f1 / 166320.0 +
408  (13860.0 - (462.0 - (132.0 - (99.0 - 140.0 / z2) / z2) / z2) / z2) /
409  z / 166320.0 + (13860.0 - (462.0 - (132.0 - (99.0 - 140.0 / x2) /
410  x2) / x2) / x2) / x1 / 166320.0 + (13860.0 - (462.0 - (132.0 -
411  (99.0 - 140.0 / w2) / w2) / w2) / w2) / w / 166320.)
412  goto finish;
413  }
414  }
415  }
416 
417  L_np_small:
418  for (;;) {
419  ix = 0;
420  f = qn;
421  double u = rand_open01();
422  for (;;) {
423  if (u < f)
424  goto finish;
425  if (ix > 110)
426  break;
427  u -= f;
428  ix++;
429  f *= (g / ix - r);
430  }
431  }
432 
433  finish:
434  if (psave > 0.5)
435  ix = n - ix;
436  return ix;
437 
438 } // RNG::binomial

442 // Generate a sample of size 'n' from a multinomial distribution with
443 // probabilities given in 'probs'. Inspired by R source code.
444 
445 void RNG::multinom(uint n, const std::vector<double>& probs, std::vector<uint>& samp)
446 {
447  samp.resize(probs.size());
448  RNG::multinom(n, &probs[0], (uint) probs.size(), &samp[0]);
449 }
450 
451 void RNG::multinom(uint size, const double* probs, uint num_probs, uint* samp)
452 {
453  if (num_probs == 0) return;
454  for (uint i = 0; i < num_probs; i++) samp[i] = 0;
455  if (size == 0) return;
456 
457  std::vector<double> fixed_probs(num_probs);
458  double total_prob = 0.;
459  for (uint i = 0; i < num_probs; i++) {
460  const double pp = probs[i];
461  //if (std::isfinite(pp) && pp >= 0)
462  if ((pp == pp) && pp >= 0)
463  total_prob += (fixed_probs[i] = pp);
464  }
465 
466  if (total_prob == 0.) return;
467 
468  for (uint i = 0; i < num_probs-1; i++) {
469  if (fixed_probs[i] > 0.) {
470  samp[i] = binomial(fixed_probs[i] / total_prob, size);
471  size -= samp[i];
472  }
473  if (size == 0) return;
474  total_prob -= fixed_probs[i];
475  }
476  samp[num_probs - 1] = size;
477 
478 }
479 void RNG::multinom(uint size, const double* probs, uint num_probs, uint* samp, uint &maxS)
480 {
481  if (num_probs == 0) return;
482  for (uint i = 0; i < num_probs; i++) samp[i] = 0;
483  if (size == 0) return;
484 
485  std::vector<double> fixed_probs(num_probs);
486  double total_prob = 0.;
487  for (uint i = 0; i < num_probs; i++) {
488  const double pp = probs[i];
489  //if (std::isfinite(pp) && pp >= 0)
490  if ((pp == pp) && pp >= 0)
491  total_prob += (fixed_probs[i] = pp);
492  }
493 
494  if (total_prob == 0.) return;
495  uint maxsize = 0;
496  maxS = 0;
497  for (uint i = 0; i < num_probs-1; i++) {
498  if (fixed_probs[i] > 0.) {
499  samp[i] = binomial(fixed_probs[i] / total_prob, size);
500  if(samp[i] > maxsize){
501  maxS = i;
502  maxsize = samp[i];
503  }
504  size -= samp[i];
505  }
506  if (size == 0) return;
507  total_prob -= fixed_probs[i];
508  }
509  samp[num_probs - 1] = size;
510  if(samp[num_probs - 1] > maxsize){
511  maxS = num_probs-1;
512  //maxsize = samp[num_probs-1];
513  }
514 }
515 void RNG::multinom(const double* probs, uint num_probs, uint &sample){
516  double u = rand_open01();
517  double sum = probs[0];
518  for(uint i=0;i<num_probs;){
519  if(u < sum){
520  sample = i;
521  return;
522  }
523  sum += probs[++i];
524  }
525  sample = (num_probs-1);
526 }
527 // RNG::multinomial
